sen.j: 坂田神明宮（さかたしんめいぐう）は滋賀県米原市近江町に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine is a Shinto shrine that exists in Omi-cho, Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Omi-cho, Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existsをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Omi-cho, Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Tachibana (mandarin orange tree) in the circle
Tachibana (mandarin orange tree) in the circle
Tachibana (mandarin orange tree) in the circle
It is one of Moto Ise (shrines or places where the deities of Ise Jingu Shrine were once enshrined).
It is one of Moto Ise (shrines or places where the deities of Ise Jingu Shrine were once enshrined).
It is one of Moto Ise (shrines or places where the deities of Ise Jingu Shrine were once enshrined).

sen.j: 神道五部書『倭姫命世記』によると、伊勢の大神が垂仁天皇8年（紀元前1世紀）に「甲可日雲宮（現在の甲賀市日雲神社）」から遷り、2年間本神社の地に留まった元伊勢と伝わっている。
sen.e: According to the description of Shinto Gobusho in "Yamatohime no mikoto seiki," the shrine is a Moto Ise where Ise no Okami (Great God of Ise) moved in 31 B.C. from 'Kafukanohinokumono-miya Shrine (present Hikumo-jinja Shrine in Koga City) to the place of Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine and stayed there for two years.

According to the description of Shinto Gobusho in "Yamatohime no mikoto seiki," the shrine is a Moto Ise where Ise no Okami (Great God of Ise) moved in 31 B.C. from 'Kafukanohinokumono-miya Shrine (present Hikumo-jinja Shrine in Koga City) to the place of Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine and stayed there for two years.

According to the description of Shinto Gobusho in "Yamatohime no mikoto seiki," the shrine is a Moto Ise where Ise no Okami (Great God of Ise) moved in 31 B.C. from 'Kafukanohinokumono-miya Shrine (present Hikumo-jinja Shrine in Koga City) to the place of Sakatashinmei-gu Shrine and stayed there for two years.
It was also called Sakata no miya Shrine.
It was also called Sakata no miya Shrine.
It was also called Sakata no miya Shrine.

sen.j: 享保18年（1733年）に時の彦根藩主井伊直惟の崇敬を受け社頭が整備されて以降、彦根藩からの厚い保護を受けた。
sen.e: The shrine received a large patronage from Hikone domain since Naonobu II, the lord at the time of Hikone domain venerated the shrine and developed the front of the shrine.
The shrine had received a large patronage from Hikone domain since Naonobu II, the lord at the time of Hikone domain venerated the shrine and developed the front of the shrine.
sen.cmt: receivedをhad receivedに変更しました。
sen.e: The shrine had received a large patronage from Hikone domain since Naonobu II, the lord at the time of Hikone domain venerated the shrine and developed the front of the shrine.

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）に郷社、昭和20年（1945年）に県社に列格した。
sen.e: In 1881 was listed as gosha (village shrine) and in 1945 as prefectural shrine.
It was listed as a village shrine In 1881 and in 1945 as a prefectural shrine.
sen.cmt: 括弧を外すように訳を変えました。
sen.e: It was listed as a village shrine In 1881 and in 1945 as a prefectural shrine.

sen.cmt: 大文字に変更しました。

tit.j: 後陽成天皇宸翰天照皇大神神号掛軸
tit.e: The hanging scroll picture of Amaterasu Omikami painted by Emperor Goyozei
